creator: fabio.gurgone@nextre.it
text:
Example:
includer.jsp : <jsp:include page="inner_ko.jsp"/>

inner_ko.jsp : Hi, with this < the include hangs

inner_ok.jsp : Hi, now it works

This works with tomcat 2.2.20

creator: markt@apache.org
text: You need to encode the included '<'

creator: fabio.gurgone@nextre.it
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> You need to encode the included '<'

With the previous version my example works and the inner_ko.jsp is a valid 
JSP (calling it directly it works fine). 
Why '<' should be encoded (or escaped?) ?

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
My bad - there is no need to encode the <. However, your test case works for me
with the latest source from svn.

creator: fabio.gurgone@nextre.it
text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> This works with tomcat 2.2.20

I wrote the wrong version...it's 5.5.20
